intro: Silene tenorei, commonly known as the Sicilian catchfly, is a flowering plant native to the island of Sicily. It is a member of the Caryophyllaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive pink to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or calcareous soils and is often found in open habitats such as scrublands and grassy slopes. Silene tenorei is a perennial herb with slender stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
